name: regexp-download-organizer
description: Chrome extension that allows you to set custom download locations with flexible regexp-based rules
longDescription: Transform your chaotic Downloads folder into an organized file system with intelligent RegExp-based rules. Automatically sort downloads by URL patterns, file types, dates, and custom criteria. Perfect for developers, content creators, and anyone who values organized digital life.

scripts.build: npm run compile && npm run copy-assets
scripts.dev: npm run build && npm run watch
scripts.proto: npm run build && echo 'Extension built! Load the dist/ folder in Chrome at chrome://extensions/'
scripts.help: type docs\HELP.md 2>NUL || cat docs/HELP.md || echo 'Help documentation not found'
scripts.about: type docs\ABOUT.md 2>NUL || cat docs/ABOUT.md || echo 'About documentation not found'
scripts.docs: echo Opening documentation... && start docs\HELP.md || open docs/HELP.md || echo 'Unable to open docs, see docs/HELP.md'
scripts.validate-full: npm run type-check && npm run lint
scripts.test-cli: npm run build && node bin/regexp-download-organizer.js info
scripts.prepack: npm run clean && npm run build && npm run validate
scripts.release: npm run clean && npm run build && npm run zip && echo 'Release package created!'
scripts.install-dev: npm install && echo 'Development environment ready! Run: npm run dev'
scripts.debug: echo 'Extension Debug Instructions:' && echo '1. Open chrome://extensions/' && echo '2. Find "RegExp Download Organizer"' && echo '3. Click "Inspect views: service worker"' && echo '4. Download a file and check console output'
scripts.webstore: node -e "const pkg = require('./package.json'); console.log('Chrome Web Store:', pkg.homepage)" && start "" "https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/regexp-download-organizer/oamembonjndgangicfphlckkdmagpjlg"
scripts.github: node -e "const pkg = require('./package.json'); console.log('GitHub Repository:', pkg.repository.url.replace('.git', ''))" && start "" "https://github.com/unintended/download-organizer-chrome-extension"
scripts.update-manifest: node -e "const pkg = require('./package.json'); const fs = require('fs'); const manifest = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync('src/manifest.json')); manifest.version = pkg.version; fs.writeFileSync('src/manifest.json', JSON.stringify(manifest, null, 2))"
scripts.sync-version: npm run update-manifest && echo 'Version synced between package.json and manifest.json'
scripts.project-stats: node -e "const fs = require('fs'); const path = require('path'); function countFiles(dir, ext) { try { return fs.readdirSync(dir, {recursive: true}).filter(f => f.endsWith(ext)).length; } catch { return 0; } } console.log('Project Statistics:'); console.log('TypeScript files:', countFiles('src', '.ts')); console.log('HTML files:', countFiles('src', '.html')); console.log('JSON files:', countFiles('src', '.json')); console.log('Total src files:', fs.readdirSync('src', {recursive: true}).filter(f => fs.statSync(path.join('src', f)).isFile()).length);"
